reviewText: One of the best movies I have ever watched. Harrison Ford and Liam Neeson excel in their roles.

Review of the movie only. That's an interesting thought coming from an old Cold Warrior. Having been in a nuclear sub underway I can relate to these crewman. What I could not relate to was the duality of command. That said, and it's only my problem, this is one heck of a movie. I have used this movie to teach the Cold War Era to my 11th grade history students. Since they understand that I was in the U.S. Navy they have learned much about shipboard, submarine and life as an aircrewman. Watching this movie they began to understand what was happening during that era not only to the Soviet Union, but with discussions, and to the United States. The only other movie that comes close to teaching this lesson is Thirteen Days [Blu-ray].
Excellent movie and received it in a relatively short time
